workflow.name: Generate SEO content briefs with GPT-4o, DataForSEO keyword research & SERP analysis
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Generate high-quality, SEO-optimized content briefs automatically using AI, real-time keyword research, SERP intelligence, and historical content context. This workflow standardizes user inputs, fetches search metrics, analyzes competitors, and produces structured SEO briefs with quality scoring and version control. It also stores all versions in Google Sheets and generates HTML previews for easy review and publishing. ü§ñüìÑüìà

## What This Template Does
- Normalizes user input from the chat trigger into structured fields (intent, topic, parameters). ‚úèÔ∏è
- Fetches real-time keyword metrics such as search volume, CPC, and difficulty from DataForSEO. üîç
- Retrieves SERP insights through SerpAPI for top competitors, headings, and content gaps. üåê
- Loads historical brief versions from Google Sheets for continuity and versioning. üìö
- Uses an advanced GPT-4o-mini agent to generate a complete SEO brief with title, metadata, keywords, outline, entities, and internal links. ü§ñ
- Calculates detailed SEO, differentiation, and completeness quality scores. üìä
- Validates briefs against quality thresholds (outline length, keywords, word count, overall score). ‚ö°
- Stores approved briefs in Google Sheets with version control and timestamping. üóÇÔ∏è
- Generates an HTML preview with styled formatting for team review or CMS use. üñ•Ô∏è
- Sends Slack alerts when a brief does not meet quality standards. üö®

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Fully automated SEO content brief generation
 ‚úÖ Uses real-time keyword + SERP + competitor intelligence
 ‚úÖ Ensures quality through automated scoring and validation
 ‚úÖ Built-in version control for content operations teams
 ‚úÖ Beautiful HTML preview ready for editors or clients
 ‚úÖ Reduces research time from hours to minutes
 ‚úÖ Ideal for content agencies, SEO teams, and AI-powered workflows

## Features
- Chat-triggered brief generation
- Real-time DataForSEO keyword metrics
- SERP analysis tool integration
- GPT-4o-mini structured AI agent
- Google Sheets integration for storing & retrieving versions
- Automated quality scoring (SEO, gaps, completeness)
- HTML preview builder with rich formatting
- Slack alerting for low-quality briefs
- Semantic entities, content gaps, competitor insights

## Requirements
- OpenAI API (GPT-4o-mini or compatible model)
- DataForSEO access credentials (Basic Auth)
- SerpAPI key for SERP extraction
- Google Sheets OAuth2 integration
- Optional: Slack webhook for quality alerts

## Target Audience
- SEO teams generating large amounts of content briefs
- Content agencies scaling production with automation
- Marketing teams building data-driven content strategies
- SaaS teams wanting automated keyword-based briefs
- Anyone needing structured, high-quality content briefs from chat

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1. Connect your OpenAI API credential and confirm GPT-4o-mini availability. üîå
2. Add DataForSEO HTTP Basic Auth for keyword metrics. üìä
3. Connect SerpAPI for SERP analysis tools. üåê
4. Add Google Sheets OAuth2 and link your content_versions sheet. üìÑ
5. Optional: Add a Slack webhook URL for quality alerts. üîî
6. Test by sending a topic via the chat trigger.
7. Review the generated SEO brief and HTML preview.
8. Enable the workflow for continued use in your content pipeline. üöÄ

workflow.name: Generate SEO Content Briefs from Chat Input Using AI, DataForSEO, SERP Analysis & Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## üìù AI-Powered SEO Content Brief Generator

### How it works
This workflow generates comprehensive, data-driven SEO content briefs using real-time keyword research, competitor analysis, and SERP intelligence. An AI agent analyzes search volume, keyword difficulty, content gaps, and competitor strategies to create briefs with quality scoring, versioning, and HTML previews. All briefs are automatically stored in Google Sheets with version control.

### Setup steps
1. **Connect credentials**: OpenAI API, DataForSEO, SerpAPI, Google Sheets OAuth2
2. **Configure Google Sheet**: Create sheets named `content_versions` with columns: content_id, version_no, version_id, topic, meta_title, meta_desc, outline, keywords, tone, word_count, cta_ideas, context_used, timestamp
3. **Set Slack webhook** (optional): Replace webhook URL in "Send Quality Alert" node for low-quality brief notifications
4. **Test the workflow**: Send a topic via chat trigger and review the generated brief

*Note: This workflow uses GPT-4o-mini for cost-effective brief generation with consistent quality.*

## üéØ Input Normalization

Standardizes incoming chat messages into a consistent format (intent, topic, content, parameters) for downstream processing.

## üîç Keyword Research

Fetches real-time search volume, keyword difficulty, and CPC data from DataForSEO to inform brief recommendations.

## ü§ñ AI Brief Generation

The AI agent combines keyword data, SERP analysis, competitor intelligence, and historical content from Google Sheets to generate comprehensive briefs with structured JSON output.

## ‚úÖ Quality Control & Storage

Calculates quality scores across SEO, differentiation, and completeness dimensions. Validates briefs against minimum thresholds, generates HTML previews, and stores approved briefs in Google Sheets with version control.

## üîê Required Credentials

- **OpenAI API**: For GPT-4o-mini brief generation
- **DataForSEO**: Basic auth for keyword metrics
- **SerpAPI**: For real-time SERP analysis
- **Google Sheets OAuth2**: For context retrieval and brief storage
- **Slack Webhook** (optional): For quality alerts

Replace all placeholder credentials before activating.

options.systemMessage:
=You are "Brief Writer Agent", a senior SEO content strategist AI.

You have access to:
1. Keyword metrics (volume, difficulty, CPC)
2. Deep competitor analysis (headings, word counts)
3. Content gap opportunities
4. Internal linking suggestions
5. Entity and semantic analysis
6. SERP Intelligence
7. Historical content from Sheets

üéØ ENHANCED BRIEF GENERATION

**Use Keyword Data:**
- Prioritize high volume + low difficulty
- Include CPC for commercial intent
- Add LSI keywords from entities

**Use Competitor Analysis:**
- Match or exceed word count by 15-20%
- Improve on common H2 patterns
- Exploit competitor weaknesses

**Use Content Gaps:**
- Create H2s for missed topics
- Address unanswered PAA questions
- Include unique angles

**Use Internal Links:**
- Suggest 3-5 related articles
- Include anchor text recommendations

üìÑ VERSIONING
1. Check Sheets for existing topic
2. If exists: reuse content_id, increment version_no
3. If new: create CNT-<timestamp>, version_no = 1

üì§ OUTPUT FORMAT

{
  "brief": {
    "title": "string",
    "meta_description": "string",
    "target_keywords": [
      {
        "keyword": "string",
        "volume": number,
        "difficulty": number,
        "priority": "primary|secondary"
      }
    ],
    "outline": [
      {
        "h2": "string",
        "h3_suggestions": ["string"],
        "purpose": "competitor_match|content_gap|paa_answer"
      }
    ],
    "word_count": number,
    "tone": "string",
    "cta_ideas": ["string"],
    "internal_links": [
      {
        "anchor_text": "string",
        "target_content_id": "string",
        "relevance_score": number
      }
    ],
    "semantic_entities": ["string"],
    "content_gaps_addressed": ["string"]
  },
  "competitive_intel": {
    "avg_competitor_word_count": number,
    "top_3_competitors": ["string"],
    "our_advantage": ["string"],
    "difficulty_assessment": "easy|medium|hard"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "content_id": "string",
    "version_no": number,
    "version_id": "string",
    "is_new_topic": boolean
  },
  "quality_scores": {
    "seo_score": number,
    "differentiation_score": number,
    "completeness_score": number,
    "overall_score": number
  },
  "context_used": ["string"]
}

üìå RULES
- Use ALL data sources
- Data-driven decisions
- If competitor avg is 2000 words, recommend 2300-2400
- Address 3+ content gaps
- Include entities in keywords
- Calculate quality scores
- Return JSON ONLY

nodes.name: Fetch Keyword Metrics from DataForSEO
nodes.notes: Fetches search volume, keyword difficulty, and CPC data

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
